title: 107_hr3285
content: The Act titled as the "Federal-Local Information Sharing Partnership Act of 2001" authorizes the sharing of grand jury information. Rule 6(e)(3)(C) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure is amended to allow sharing of grand jury information with law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision. The amended Rule 6(e)(3)(C) allows sharing of grand jury information with State or political subdivision law enforcement personnel, who must use the information in accordance with guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 3. AUTHORITY TO SHARE ELECTRONIC, WIRE, AND ORAL INTERCEPTION INFORMATION. Section 2517(6) of title 18, United States Code, is amended to allow sharing of interception information with law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision. Law enforcement personnel at the state or local level can share interception information as long as they follow guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 4. FOREIGN INTELLIGENCE INFORMATION. Section 203(d)(1) of the USA PATRIOT ACT is amended to allow sharing of information with state law enforcement personnel, removing the requirement for federal involvement. The USA PATRIOT ACT is amended to allow state law enforcement personnel to receive information without federal involvement, with guidelines for confidentiality. SEC. 5. DISCLOSURES TO GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES FOR COUNTERTERRORISM PURPOSES. Section 626(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act is amended to allow recipients of consumer reports to disclose information to law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision to assist in official duties. The Fair Credit Reporting Act allows recipients of consumer reports to disclose information to law enforcement personnel for official duties, with guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 6. MULTILATERAL COOPERATION AGAINST TERRORISTS. Section 222(f) of the Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to allow the Secretary of State to provide records related to visas or permits to law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision. The Secretary of State can provide visa or permit records to law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision, with guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 7 amends the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act to include state law enforcement personnel in information acquisition. SEC. 8 addresses information acquired from physical searches. SEC. 8 amends the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act to include state law enforcement personnel in information acquisition from physical searches. Section 444(j)(1)(B) of the General Education Provisions Act is amended to allow disclosure of education records to state law enforcement personnel, including the chief executive officer, for official duties. The General Education Provisions Act is amended to allow disclosure of education records to state law enforcement personnel, with the condition that the information is used in accordance with guidelines. SEC. 10. INVESTIGATION AND PROSECUTION OF TERRORISM. Section 408(c)(1)(B) of the National Education Statistics Act of 1994 is amended to allow for the disclosure of reports, records, and information to law enforcement personnel for official duties. The National Education Statistics Act of 1994 is amended to allow for the disclosure of information to law enforcement personnel, with guidelines on how the information can be used by chief executive officers or law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision.
